result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelli N. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelli N. Schultz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelli N. Schultz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall pay restitution directly to Clerk of Courts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not go on any property owned by Casey's.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and document with DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelli N. Schultz

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: DOC request to amend spelling of defendant's first name--approved to correct to Kelli

Defendant Kelly N. Schultz in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cale C Plamann in court for Kelly N. Schultz. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Ct 1 and state will move to dismiss Ct 2. State will recommend 1 year probation with the following conditions: to pay restitution, court costs, not go any property owned by Casey's, work full time or seek full time work, and DNA. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1. Ct 2 dismiss per agreement. State heard. Attorney Plamann heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: to pay restitution, court costs, submit a DNA sample, not to be on any property of Casey's, and to be employed full time or to seek work by 3 applications a week and document with DOC.

Defendant Kelly N. Schultz in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. She did retain an attorney but he could not appear today. State would like to add a no contact with Casey's to bond. Court orders bond to be amended to show no contact with Casey's. DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH CASEY'S PROPERTY.

Defendant Kelly N. Schultz appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD and will try to retain attorney. State requests signature bond. Court orders $1000 signature bond. Arraignment date set.
